explanations.summary: Parasympathetic vasodilator neurotransmitters: (1) ACh - activates eNOS in endothelium, (2) VIP - direct smooth muscle relaxation, (3) NO - released as cotransmitter. NOT: NPY (sympathetic), PGI2 (from endothelium not nerves), adrenaline (sympathetic).

whyCorrect.c: VIP (vasoactive intestinal polypeptide) is released from parasympathetic nerves and causes direct smooth muscle relaxation.
whyCorrect.d: Acetylcholine is the primary parasympathetic neurotransmitter. In blood vessels, it acts on endothelial muscarinic receptors to release NO, causing vasodilation.
whyCorrect.e: NO (nitric oxide) is released as a cotransmitter from some parasympathetic nerve endings, directly causing vasodilation via cGMP.

whyIncorrect.a: NPY (neuropeptide Y) is released from SYMPATHETIC nerve endings and causes vasoconstriction.
whyIncorrect.b: Prostacyclin (PGI2) is produced by vascular ENDOTHELIUM, not released from nerve endings.
whyIncorrect.f: Adrenaline (epinephrine) is from adrenal medulla and sympathetic system, not parasympathetic.
